pullrequest.title: per issue #194, alternative solution, add ROS service, allowing user to change joint damping with hard coded per joint bounds

content.raw:
Could it be that the other robot joints are too stiff? It should be possible for damping at other joints to assist; it doesn't all have to come from the ankle.

Consider an inverted [Acrobot](http://webdocs.cs.ualberta.ca/~sutton/book/ebook/node110.html) as an analogy to Atlas. The acrobot has not torque at its fixed joint (analogous to Atlas's ankle joint), but there are control algorithms that can stabilize the Acrobot using the actuator at the middle joint (analogous to Atlas's hip, knees, etc.).
content.html:
Could it be that the other robot joints are too stiff? It should be possible for damping at other joints to assist; it doesn't all have to come from the ankle.

Consider an inverted Acrobot as an analogy to Atlas. The acrobot has not torque at its fixed joint (analogous to Atlas's ankle joint), but there are control algorithms that can stabilize the Acrobot using the actuator at the middle joint (analogous to Atlas's hip, knees, etc.).
